comment.text: I was in town on travel for work, and I stopped through this location and Tony had the most excellent service that you can ask for and the pizza is really delicious

The Nashville Hot Chicken pizza is the best pizza on the menu. It. Just. Works. I loved it way more than my custom pizza. 

I also got a pizza with plant based sausage and pepperoni. I couldn't tell the difference in flavor from regular meat. I had to verify it was plant based lol. VERY good. 

Pizza is made to order within ~10mins from order to first bite. The staff is alright they give the level of service I'd expect in a fast casual spot. Because there's a wait time for the pizza, seating is usually taken by folks waiting on their pizza but frees up once they get it and head out. Not a lot stay and eat in.

photos.caption: Build Your Own - Spicy Red Sauce, Got 5 Blend, Spinach, Pepperoni, Canadian Bacon, Chicken Sausage, Roasted Red Pepper

comment.text:
Being in town, my boyfriend wanted pizza - so to Slim & Husky we went! The only reason this location cannot get 5 stars, is because their stated hourly schedule is not correct to what they practice.

When their schedule is accurate, the store is opened and staff is present, their food is good! It was just an inconvenience to us the first night that we couldn't get the pizza and wings until the next night!

Story Outline

Setting: Artsy, Loud Rap Music, Clean and Spacious, Safe Area, Order/Pay at Kiosks, Looked Closed at First (because of unused, darkened patio)

Character: Black Owned and Celebrated, Predominantly Black Crowd (didn't seem to mind this white girl joining the party)

Plot: Slim is a Personal-Sized Flatbread Pizza; Husky is a Shareable-Sized Flatbread Pizza (same style, same crust, different quantity); Customize or Try a House Specialty; All the Drizzles (sauces) are Game-Changer Delicious; Save Room for Dessert Rolls! 

Theme: S&H Wings Alone are Worth the Long Drive from Kennesaw!

Saw a friend post about Slim & Husky's, so while in Atlanta last weekend, I decided to check them out. 
I did an online order. 
When I went inside, I noticed the cool artwork on the walls, the "quaint" inside (it's not really a big restaurant), & the loud hip-hop. Now, mind you, I'm a huge hip-hop fan, but when it's so loud you're trying to think or eat inside the restaurant is a not-so-great experience. They have an area for pick up orders/delivery service. I went there & waited patiently. No one came. All the workers were on the other side, cooking/preparing. The inside wasn't busy. When I went to the register, I told one employee I needed to pick up my "to go" order. He asked me to step back over to where I had just come from. 
He didn't seem too happy, but got my pizza from the warmer & I was on my way. 

The pizza was pretty good. Maybe it was just an off day for them. I do want to try them again & try another pizza. I follow them on Instagram & everyone's pizzas look so good! So I'm willing to try them another time. 

Prices are reasonable. Parking on the street or in the deck.

The artwork is very nice inside. The tables were clean and it was an easy check out process at the kiosk. The pizza was great, I put a lot of meats and multiple cheeses. Everything was evenly distributed and I even ordered another to go which tasted better after everything marinated and I brought it back to life in my air fryer the next day.

I am upset that I have not been coming to this place the entire time. This place is amazing. The guy named Tony that works here is the best. He really took care of us.

We got here with about 30 minutes to closing. We tried to get here earlier but timing was not on our side. Staff acted like they were happy to see us and we felt welcomed.

I ordered the monthly special with a Cookie Monsta Cinnamon Roll. 

Tony made sure our food was made to perfection. He even made sure we had the best drizzle with our pizzas. The cinnamon roll was made to perfection. 

We made sure to leave before closing but I think they wouldn't have minded either way.

absolutely the best pizza we have ever had! we are from the East Coast and from CT to the DMV nobody does  pizza better! Great accomplishment Guys. please support this black owned business. excellent service as well!!!

Their cinnamon rolls are very good and I only go there for them! There's nothing wrong with their pizza, I'm just not a fan of the style of pizza they make. My favorite cinnamon rolls are the strawberry shortcake and the Blueberry and Lemon rolls. If you have the munchies, looking for something to snack on or just want to grab something sweet look no further than here and go get you one of these cinnamon rolls.

photos.caption: Too Short Cakes( Strawberry Shortcake) Cinnamon Rolls

comment.text:
I was a loyal customer here when I lived in Nashville and I was so excited to see that they expanded to Atlanta! 

I always make my own pizza - I love all their options for veggies! You might think to yourself I should just get a slim - but whenever I do that I regret it! Order a husky size pizza for yourself and if there are left overs lucky you!

I never pass up the cinnamon rolls either. What a combo. I'm a huge fan of their berry one, but every option is terrific. yum!!

Yo, this pizza is sooo good! One tip, don't build your own pizza. Try one of their specialties! They've really crafted some deliciousness. 

Today, Slim +Huskies was provided for a group for lunch. I'd had it before from a different location and wasn't very impressed, but today was a totally different story. So much so, that I ended up ordering pizza from here myself later in the day. 

Thankfully, because of how small the slices are cut on the slims, I could taste test a few if the different options that were provided for lunch. Let me just tell you, I never thought I was a white sauce girl, but the PREAM and Smokin' Herb + Salmon are AMAZING!! Probably my new favorite pizza. The PREAM is basically supreme, but with white sauce (not too much, just enough so that your pizza isn't dry) instead of red. The other was a white sauce based pizza as well, with salmon, cheese, onion, and mushroom. The Ronny Roni Rone, a traditional pepperoni pizza, was delicious as well. The OG red sauce is perfect. The smokin' herb + chicken was ok. My least favorite, but still cool. When I went back later in the day I went with the PREAM slim and it gave everything it was supposed to give! 

They have two new pizzas, Buffalo shrimp and Buffalo chicken. Right now the Buffalo chicken pizza is Pizza of the Month, which means you can get the husky (large) for just $10 all of June. 

Service, based on takeout, was good. It was ready right when I got there and the young lady was friendly. The space was really clean. Garage is kinda sketch so I opted for street parking, especially since I knew I'd be in and out. Overall, I'm a fan! I had a much better experience at this location than I did at Old Nat.
Waited over an hour for pizza when ordered online.  Complete chaos inside and no one seems to know what they are doing.

BRUHHHH . Is all i gotta say. I got the lemon pepper wings which I'll remember for the rest of my life. I also got the salmon pizza which was also delicious. Also they have a pineapple cream soda which i have never had before. Everything was great here

TL;DR: I really wanted to like Slim & Husky's but it was really average.

ARRIVAL: I came here on a Saturday around 530 pm. It wasn't too busy inside the restaurants, with a handful of families with kids just finishing up dining in and an almost-steady flow of one party coming in for pick up orders at a time.

AMBIANCE: Furniture looks like small chipotle. Light wooden benches/seating and stone accent pillars. Large wall artwork gives it a down to earth character.

MENU: You order on one of the screens when you arrive and our payment attachment was broken, so we did the pay at register option. The menu has 10" and 16" pizzas and are craft flatbread-style. I love unexpected pizza combinations, but i really didn't love any of these. They also have a BYO option which will probably satisfy most. We ordered a  slim pepperoni with extra house blend cheese, 1 slim Nashville hot chicken with jalapeno cilantro ranch drizzle, 2 cinnamon rolls (1 OG, 1 Cookie Monsta), 2 fountain drinks.

DRINKS: I LOVE that they have craft sodas here! Black cherry soda is usually my favorite, but this one had the addition of tarragon so i'm glad i tried it first and it just doesn't hit the same. I got the pineapple cream instead and yum! I've only seen these at once at a totally different restaurant in California and they're still great. We planned to order the blue frosty drink, but it's not listed in the ordering system and we had to pay at the register, so we asked about it and the man gave us a sample letting us know that people had been saying it was too sweet; my boyfriend tried it and it was indeed even too sweet for him (when usually he has no limits) so we skipped that.

FOOD: This is the interesting part....I was extremely hungry this day as we ended up here because traffic was to bad getting where we wanted to go up north and yet, my nashville hot chicken pizza was honestly....tasteless. While the pizzas looked great, they genuinely had no taste. I have never experienced this nor did i have trouble tasting the soda for example or the cinnamon rolls, but the pizza wasn't at all spicy despite having jalapenos, banana peppers, with hot honey AND the jalapeno cilantro drizzle and genuinely flavorless including the chicken. The pepperoni didn't look like it had the extra cheese we ordered and got the same review of being tasteless. All three cinnamon rolls OG, Cookie Monsta, and Strawberry shortcake were extremely soft in an undercooked way (explanation why we ended up with 3 to follow) not in the desired pillowy-pastry way. The dough as you can see from the photos don't look like they had a good rise either, they just look flat and rolled out. The toppings and drizzles were completely melted and all over the box and each other. I'm perfectly happy eating desserts that leave a huge mess, but these weren't nearly worth it. I also love desserts and pastries, but i had one bite of the OG and cookie mosta and didn't want any more. I want to be clear that the pizzas were BAD but they also weren't good, it was genuinely just tasteless despite looking great.

CLEANLINESS: Tables weren't clean when we arrived and took quite a while for someone to come out and clean tables, but I appreciate that they had someone come out at all as (hostess-seated restaurants aside) this isn't something I commonly see in ATL. He did also ask if i wanted to him to wipe down the table I was already sitting at which was very much appreciated as well even thought it wasn't visibly super dirty.

SERVICE: The cashier was friendly and informative (see above). The man that came to clean the table was also friendly and made the effort to clean our table while we waited for pizza. There was a small mishap. We waited around 30 mins for our pizza and when they finally called us (they just call your name from the pick up area) and my boyfriend went to get them, he watched as guy dropped my pizza.... So he returned to our table empty handed and we proceeded to wait an extra 8 mins for then to make a replacement. They held my boyfriend's pepperoni during this time and it just sat there in the box getting cold and cheese congealing. They did offer an extra cinnamon roll for the wait which is how we ended up with 3 instead of 2, and they gave us an extra jalapeno cilantro drizzle (i already had one) and pineapple chipotle BBQ drizzle, which didn't seem nearly enough for the entire wait and mistake.

EXPERIENCE: Overall with this experience, I was not happy and already thinking that I didn't want to return. It's just down the street from me and I was excited to have a craft pizza spot that's also POC-owned, but unfortunately I don't think i'll be returning.

PRICE: On par with prices in ATL and the west midtown area. 2 pizzas, 2 cinnamon rolls, 2 drinks came out to be just under $50.

OVERALL: I won't be returning here.

photos.caption: BYO pepperoni with extra house blend cheese

comment.text: Stopped in for dinner on our way to a Yelp Elite event. I had been seeing great reviews and it was so close to the venue we had to give Slim + Husky's a try. We shared a husky, side salad, and cinnamon rolls (2-pack). Everything tasted delicious. The salad and pizza toppings were fresh and the cinnamon rolls were baked well (no raw dough, but not over baked/dried out either). Our pizza was a bit "center loaded" so the crust in the middle was not as crisp as the outside pieces so it made it a little more difficult and messy to eat, but the flavor was still good. Next time we will probably choose a recipe that has fewer toppings or build-our-own.
I absolutely LOVE this Slim & Husky's! They are always so nice and the food is AMAZING!!

I heard about this pizza spot a while ago. But...it's not in the D.C. area...YET. Well while was in Atlanta, guess what?? I slid through!! With Craft pizzas, & a build your own option, I was truly excited!! Join me...Let's see what they're hittin on!!
.
Where I am: @Slimandhuskys
                            #The Roll Out
.
Location Reviewed: 1016 Howell Mill Rd. Atlanta Georgia
.
Menu Includes:
Craft Pizzas like their Cali Love Veggie, Cee No Gree Pie, Smoking Herb with Salmon or Chicken Pie. Build your Own Pie with OG Red sauce, Spicy Red sauce, White sauce, Vegan, Fresh mozzarella, Artichoke, Bacon, Nashville Hot Chicken, Beef or Pork Pepperoni or Sausage, Drizzles, Dips, Craft Beverages, The Roll Out Cinnamon Buns & MUCH MORE!!
.
Items Reviewed: (BYO includes a 10" or 16" size option)

Their 10 inch Slim Got Cheese Pizza (with OG red sauce, house blend cheese, & fresh mozzarella $14). STAMP!! A magnificent cheese blend, tangy but mild marinara, & a buttery crust!!

Their 16 inch Build Your Own Pizza (with house cheese, jalapeños, pepperoni, Nashville hot chicken, spicy red marinara, and garlic drizzle $16). STAMP!! This is the BEST build your own pizza I've ever had!! Fresh, edible crust, & spiced right marinara!!

Their Big Poppa Pie (with house blend cheese, beef pepperoni, sausage, green peppers, red onions, & garlic drizzle $26). STAMP!! HUGE, tasty, & will feed the crew!!

Their sauces-Unique & Bursting with flavor.
Stoneground Peach Mustard...STAMP!!
Pineapple Chipotle BBQ...STAMP!!
Jalapeño Cilantro Ranch...STAMP!!
Honey Sriracha Mayo...STAMP!!

Their Garlic Knots ($3). DELICIOUS, especially with any of their sauces.

Their Craft Sodas-Vanilla Cream Agave, Black Cherry, & Root Beer $2.75...STAMP!! Refreshing!!

The Roll Out cinnamon rolls-Sweet, warm, & glazed to perfection!!
Blueberry Lemon...STAMP!!
The Cookie Monster...STAMP!!
The Old Fashion...STAMP!!
The Strawberry Shortcake...STAMP!!
.
Customer Service: It was EXCELLENT until I was at the register, & the person that walked up behind me was taken care of before I finished my transaction. They apologized.
.
Online Navigation: EASY!!
.
Parking: ROUGH in that area.
. 
Recommendations: Get the cheese, BYO, ANY of their sodas, & ALL the cinnamon buns!!

=STAMP 
=LIKE THAT
=DELICIOUS 
=DECENT
=PASS
=NAH

#Bigschlimsreviews

Met up with a large (20+) group on Friday night.  They were able to accommodate since they weren't super busy. There paid parking in the street and a garage. There was hiphop and R&Bplaying. There are great murals in the walls dedicted to artist of those genres. 
You order your food on one of 4 kiosks. They have a little bit of lag time so you have to be patient  because it's not going to pop like your phone. I got confused on how to end my order but the staff behind the counter building the pizzas are happy to give instructions. I ordered a build your own husky and a small salad. So a slim pizza is not thin crust, it's smaller than husky size. Most basic topping were free but cheese was $2 so it all balanced out.  There's a few beers and fountain sodas. Cups for water are .50c. Besides pizza, they have flavored cinnamon rolls. 
My pizza was good! Because I ordered husky. I didn't have space for the salad and barely got through the pizza. This a a simple pizza place . Nothing fancy or authentic, but there is good staff, good food and a good vibe.

photos.caption: Pizza coming out of the oven

comment.text: Great pizza and great flavors. Had some Slim & Husky's today and it really hit the mark. The pizza was delicious from the fresh made dough to the variety of ingredients. We had everything from a total vegan pizza (rocked it!) to a carnivore's delight with all the meat toppings you could ever want. The drizzles add ab extra dimension. They have such great variety from Hot Chicken to Smoked Salmon. A must try if you are in Atlanta. And don't miss out on dessert. $$

photos.caption: Great food for a team meeting

comment.text:
I'm going to turn into a pizza one day, I'm sure of it. But do you think that stops me from eating it at every turn? Absolutely not, because I am not a quitter. I'm devoted to my favorites and pizza, pizza is absolutely top 2 and it's not #2. 

My favorite thing about it? The versatility. And versatile pizza is exactly what you'll get at Slim & Husky's. This trendy, Black-owned, Hip-Hop themed Pizzeria has Nashville roots and I'm so happy that they brought that soul and spirit to Atlanta! My boyfriend ordered Slim & Husky's one night only a few days after I had moved to Atlanta. He told me he was ordering pizza, he didn't tell me that it was going to be some legendary, bomb a** pizza though. Like, prepare ya girl! I was praying it wasn't some national chain brand with cheap cheese and flavorless sauce, (that I'd still scarf down but I deserve better! lol) and then, he opens this pizza box. 

Slim & Husky's serves up flatbread-style pizza with some amazing topping options and epic specialty flavors with R&B names like Rony, Roni, Rone pepperoni pizza, the vegetarian California Love and the Red Light Special margarita style, the options are there! Their tasty drizzle options such as the Cilantro Ranch and Garlic Butter are soooo good although, possibly not the healthiest options lol. I've tasted a few specialty pizzas and love building my own pizza as well, each pizza has always been a hit! Onto the cinnamon rolls - phew. (I always say that I'm not a sweets person in all of my reviews and I know that people are sick of me lolol but here we go) I'm not usually a sweet person, I have to crave them but when it comes time for Slim & Husky's, the craving for those cinnamon rolls is so real. With super decadent flavors such as the strawberry Too Short cakes, the blueberry lemon MS Berry or even the extremely rich Sticky Fingaz which is covered in caramel sauce, bacon, whiskey and glazed pecans - crazyyyyy good.

I've only had Slim & Husky's via delivery and pickup, but during pickups, I always appreciate the awesome decor. With walls covered in Black art and Hip-Hop themed pieces, I love seeing these amazing local legends depicted on the walls, the energy is so real. 

So the next time that you're looking for a slice of heaven or are looking to support a fantastic Black-owned biz, look no further!
Pizza was solid overall. Definitely would come back if I'm in the area again. Took a while for them to make it though.

Was in a mood for some pizza and took a trip to one of my favorite places in 2021. They've changed the ordering process which could be a little confusing but the pizza still taste great. I did notice this time around that the music was blaring over the system so when I tried to ask the young man about my pizza, I don't think he clearly understood the modification I needed to make.  However, even with that small mishap the pizza was still good!  Definitely worth trying and you have to get the special red sauce. It has a little spice. Let's talk about the parking. It can be a bit chaotic, but there is a parking garage attached that allows 15 minutes of free parking. The downside is they only have four spots and they could be taken at the time you choose to go which will lead you to street parking or looking for parking two blocks south so pack your patience if it's a busy weekend and you want to give them a try!

Me and my kids came late on a Thursday and we got the best service I've had on a late night, I've been coming here for almost 3 years and it never miss  all the location are great I drove all the way from Cobb County to get this after work. It was worth the drive I legit put everyone on to this pizza spot and I'm not even a pizza person the new wings are amazing and the cinnamon bun is so good

A group of friends and I visited here after a virtual reality event we attended. This pizza is so good. I got the 'build your own' option, size: slim. We got the food fairly quickly. The only downside was that this location is current renewing their liquor license so we had to go to a bar to get drinks after eating.

photos.caption: 'Build your own' pepperoni, bacon, peppers, spinach

comment.text: Finally got to try slim and husky for the first time and it was amazing! The service was fast and easy there are now computers up where you can go and order! Which makes things a lot more efficient and fast. The pizza was nice and crispy not soggy or dry! We got two slim pizzas one was a build your self the other was there smoking herb w/ chicken. We where going to order there cinnamon rolls but they where out of the Cookie Monster sadly and we where only interested in that. We sat at there balcony area and had this pretty view of the city. They did have the music really loud out there but overall we loved the ambiance.

photos.caption: Left is the smoking herb w/ chicken and the right is build your own

comment.text: Food was good. I ordered a husky salmon pizza. I believe that that had it been hot I would have enjoyed it more. Wait time is long. Customer service was ok staff was pleasant. Seemed short staff, restroom needed to be clean. Might try it again to see if my opinion changes and my experience is better.

Flavor of the pizza is pretty good but you're going to clog a few arteries with all the grease.  And be prepared to wait.  You'll grow old waiting on how long it takes them to make the food.  We walked in and nobody else was in front of us and it took easily 30 min for a group of 8 to get our pizzas.  On top of all that they have the gall to ask for tips at the self check out screens yet they don't serve you at all.  And charge people .50 to get a cup for water.  Pretty much a fail all around.  Got just gave 2 stars because the flavor of the pizza was decent.  Won't be coming back.

This is black owned business that offers great service and even better food. Some would compare it to Blaze pizza but Slim and Husky's is far better. Oh and the different sauces you can get on the pizza top it off nicely.

I decided to stop by after a hard morning of volunteering and it was worth the visit! As I haven't visited in a while, it was great to be greeted and helped immediately during the lunch hour. The rep asked what I wanted on pizza and prepared it right away. Afterwards it didn't take much time to receive the pizza after paying and getting my drink. The one problem I had was that the noise inside of the restaurant was so loud and it wasn't music or people. Since it was loud it was hard to hear what the workers were saying. 

As for the pizza, I made my own small pizza with regular sauce, chicken, spinach, extra cheese, pepperoni and onions. And it was delicious!!! I cannot complain there!

I will be back!
Amazing! Perfectly sized personal pizzas that have an amazing taste. I got the cali luv and added chorizo and they weren't stingy!! Also got the Roni and it was the perfect pepperoni

My fiancé and I have been going to Slim and Husky's since we met. It's definitely a favorite of ours. However, after many months of not going, we were excited to indulge in their pizza on Friday night. The host was super friendly when we walked in. We both ordered the smokin herb with salmon and cinnamon rolls (Not pictured). Since they make it to order, we had a small wait, but nothing to crazy. The prices have gone up slightly, but that's everywhere these days. We were so hungry, we opted to eat in the car. It was sooo good, fresh and hot! We also had the pineapple chipotle bbq sauce!!! Be sure to get it! Overall, we thoroughly enjoy this location and we will be back again in the future!

The pizza is great, but the service was subpar. I hadn't been there in a while, so I didn't know they'd switched to digital ordering. I walk in, the young lady behind the counter never acknowledged me. 
A guy eventually comes out from the back and asks "Have you been here before?" I responded, Yes. He's like it must've been a while.... You put your order in on the screen behind you. 
Let me know if you need help.  Why didn't the young lady just look up and say that?!‍ 
The music playing was offensive; I'm glad no kiddos were around...

Always a good stop! I appreciate workers training coworkers, but when you see your line getting longer, it's time to pick up the pace.
I also recommend turning the music down a little, so the employees and customers can hear each other... especially now with these masks on.

owner_replies.comment: Thank for sharing your experience. We look forward to you dining in again!

comment.text: Pizzas are great...have never been inside (only ordered online and had delivered). No complaints with the 2 pizzas I've tried (Cali Love and Smokin Herb). I prefer my pizzas with a thin crust (which both have been thin crusted) and since I've eaten these I don't want to try another pizza spot ‍.
The bomb pizza!!! Fresh ingredients, quick service and friendly people. Our first time here but we will definitely be back.

Pizza Night at home. It's so good! Minority-owned business. We ordered online and picked up the food. Great customer service. The restaurant was clean. I noticed families sitting peacefully enjoying their meals. I didn't go to the restrooms. My family enjoyed each pizza we ordered. We will definitely return. Pizzas ordered: Big Poppa; Rony, Roni, Rone; Nothing But A "V" Thang

photos.caption: Nothing But A "V" Thang with salmon and balsamic molasses drizzle

comment.text: Morehouse location:  Pizza (Smokin' Herb Chicken) was watery!  Ingredients tasted as if they been previously frozen, and  did not thaw (and dry) properly before cooking.  Mozerella was clumpy.  Did not finish.

Good pizza! 

Slim & Husky's has a similar business model as Blaze or MOD Pizza, where you can pick from pre-selected options or build your own pizza. You can choose from 12- or 15-inch doughs (Slim or Husky)--in my opinion, the 12-inch is more than enough! The restaurant can hold large groups if necessary. They have a covered patio. 

They have beer on tap but we opted for cocktails instead. We ordered margaritas, which were pre-mixed. It would have been nice to have fresh drinks. 

We got ordered the garlic butter on the side and it was a huge miss. It was sweet...not sure if it was butter. Would've been nice if it was melted. The great thing is it didn't make or break the pizza! 

The restaurant itself is very casual. We assumed it was more formal. It would be really cool if they had a full bar or good drinks. I like the vibe...I like the music and I can see how this could be a hot spot in ATL. I do think the dining room could be a bit cleaner. But overall, the pizza was tasty and I'd go back for a quick dinner.

photos.caption: Slim size: Pepperoni, spinach, mushrooms, and banana peppers
Slim size: Pepperoni, bacon, spinach, mushrooms, and banana peppers

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for stopping by and for sharing your experience with us. So glad you enjoyed the pizza. We value all our customers feedback and will share it with our operations team for review. We appreciate your business and look forward to serving you again!

comment.text: Ordered the Nashville hot chicken pizza and a side salad! Super good!!!!! $12 huskys pizza on Tuesday!

Ep. 91 of AntlantaEats 

This is a fast, casual pizzeria that has Hip-Hop/R&B roots attached to it. Thanks to the recommendation from one of the staff, I ordered the Husky sized "Rony Roni Rone" (3 different pepperonis) absolutely delicious and crispy. Ohhhh don't let me forget the Cinnamon Rolls  --'Ms. Berry' and 'The Ninja Turtle'

Bonus: Umm this is personal one, They have Gatorade on their drink machine! (I  me some Gatorade), Jalapeno Ranch sauce, knowledgeable and attentive staff, shout out to the Manager Shannon for the service.

Here's my experience: https://www.instagram.com/p/CSpHs4eAW9T/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

photos.caption: Ms. Berry and the Ninja Turtle rolls

owner_replies.comment: We love our food bloggers. Thank you for stopping by and leaving this great review.

comment.text:
Slim & Husky's has some of the best pizza I've had. Pizza, Art, Music all in one place! They also have parking inside the parking garage behind the building.

Once you go inside you hop in line and build your pizza, similar to subway. The dough and ingredients are so fresh and staff is so nice.

This is one of my new favorite pizza spots. I highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Half Cee No Green (Meat Eaters) & Half Toni tone
Half Cee No Green (Meat Eaters) & Toni Tone

comment.text:
For the record, January decided to go here. 

I have no idea what I walked into. Let me explain! Half the line was closed down, as such, I had to place my order on the side WITH NO MENU. Can you imagine how hard this is when it's your first time visiting? Geesh. 

In case you haven't been, the draw to this establishment is that you go down the line and build your creation, ending at the cashier. Imagine the Subway flow to the max... Ok, back to the story! The cashier explained that they were short staffed which led to the partial line closure. Ok, I can understand that. The show must go on, but, goodness, can I get a paper menu or something?

Let's proceed, they had a great playlist playing and I was enjoying the music selection. However, when I tell you the volume was on CLUB! I'm talking in your ear, feel the beat through your body, can't hear my thoughts type volume. I was absolutely perplexed by this and of course, January wanted to dine-in! 

Let's talk food! I decided on a salad, the greens were fresh, the chicken was well seasoned, moist, and grilled to perfection. The salad dressing came in a packet so you can imagine the flavor, but the salad itself was flavorly enjoyable. 

Overall, I don't know how to feel about this experience. However, if you want a good salad, get it to go! Ha.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for visiting Slim + Husky's and for sharing your experience with us. Our apologies if the music was too loud but we are very glad to hear you enjoyed the food.

comment.text: Ordered for takeout. Good customers service and simple pickup. I would recommend for pretty good, quick pizza
Not only was the pizza and drinks delicious and unique, but the service we received from Khalil was incredible. Love this place!

I'm not sure how this place has 4 stars but the whole experience was horrible.  The music in the restaurant is so loud the people taking your order cannot even hear you.   I ordered a margherita pizza add pepperoni, a Rone, Roni, Rony, and a build your own for my son. We also opted for the garlic knots. My pizza was spicy and just not good. My son didn't like the cheese blend on his pizza and said his sauce was sweet, and my husband said his pizza was too soft in the middle and the taste was just not that great. He also got a beer. The establishment is a "beeria" but there were only 5 beers.  I'm not sure how many beers constitutes a "beeria". On to the garlic knots. They were  bread knots and soft however, the garlic was missing.  It was just plain bread basically.

Pros:  Customer service was nice, the restaurant was clean and they played good music.

Cons:  I took the time to drive 52 minutes to get what I thought would finally be some great pizza.  I order the salmon pizza, I don't know if was garlic butter sauce or some kind of oil on it but it was so greasy I didn't want to put the box on the seat in my car.  The salmon looked as if someone just threw it on there and it was way too salty (mind you I love salmon and I've had it multiple times so I know how it's supposed to taste).  I was disappointed with the lack of presentation and it wasn't good on top of that!  I MIGHT give them another try but not at that location, if so I'll review them too of course.

This was a major disappointment.

Loved it! It's definitely a vibe. We dined in. It wasn't very crowded as most people took their orders to go. I love that the pizzas are made in front of you and anything goes. The staff were friendly and helpful. 

As with everything right now, low staffing means not everything is addressed right away. Like some genius spilled something by the tables and left it there, but the staff were busy making pizzas and it stayed there for quite some time. Overall I'll definitely be revisiting

photos.caption: Pesto, spinach, house cheese, onions, olives and shrimp

owner_replies.comment: Hello Chan, thank you for stopping by. Yes we are experiencing low staffing which makes it harder to get to everything as quickly as we would like but we have a great management team there. I will share your feedback with them to bring this to their attention. We will make it a point to prevent this from taking so long to clean up in the future. We appreciate your feedback, glad you enjoyed yourself, and look forward to serving you again!

comment.text:
Slim and Husky's is a different type of pizzeria that I am here for. You have 2 typea of crusts to choose from, slim/husky. Then from there you can choose their custom toppings or make your own. Fory visit, I went with the slim, five on it-basically thin crust cheese pizza. They used a variety of cheeses and when I you my pizza was cheesy, think of the cheese pizza from ninja turtle days lol. Even though it was packed with cheese, the pizza sauce was also full with flavor too! I think I have another favorite pizza place in my life now! Slim and Husky's was great and anyone visiting Atlanta has to give it a try. 

Bianca

WHAT! This is the best pizza in Atlanta.
Let's argue! No seriously, I haven't found better pizza in the city, the ingredients so fresh, the seasoning... Umm I want some right now.

owner_replies.comment: This review is great. Thank you for admiring our pizza.

comment.text:
I love all of the pizzas that I've had at Slim and Husky's. The Pream has become my recent favorite. They also have great craft  beers and ciders on tap.

The cinnamon rolls are also really good. I like the OG, and the one with pecans. 

Also, the staff is really friendly at this location. 

If you're looking for pizza on the westside, Slim and Husky's is where you should go.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for visiting Slim + Husky's. We are very appreciative of your 5-star review!
